course.title: Historical Perspectives on Economic Ascendancy
course.description: An exploration of research in economic history, focusing on economic growth and development. Topics include: institutions and property rights; technological change and industrialization; migration and labor markets; local economic stimulus; and adaptation to the environment. The course emphasizes students learning to generate and implement ideas for new research.
course.prerequisites: Ec 10a and Ec 10b or permission of the instructor.
course.notes: Concentrators may not take pass/fail. This course satisfies the concentration writing requirement.
